title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of race, class, and gender in the Deep South, seen through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by Big Brother, where truth is controlled and surveillance is constant.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: The story of Holden Caulfield, a teenage boy who struggles with growing up and the phoniness of the adult world.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that critiques the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century, focusing on the turbulent relationship between Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel about the disillusionment of the American Dream, seen through the eyes of Nick Carraway, who witnesses the tragic downfall of Jay Gatsby.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: The narrative of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to kill Moby Dick, a giant white whale.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins embarks on a quest to help dwarves reclaim their homeland from the dragon Smaug.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A novel set in a future world where humanity is engineered and controlled through technology, drugs, and social conditioning.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: An epic tale that explores the lives of five families during the Napoleonic wars in Russia.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A novel that follows a young shepherd named Santiago on his journey to discover his personal legend and achieve his dreams.
